Alternatively, "The Seduction of Joe Tynan" is a thought-provoking political drama that explores the compromises and moral dilemmas faced by individuals in positions of authority, with Meryl Streep delivering a captivating performance. Enjoy!

Given that you're interested in war-themed movies and enjoy a good sounding title, I'd recommend giving "The Monuments Men" a try! It's a unique tale about a group of experts who travel to Europe during World War II on a mission to rescue priceless pieces of art from the hands of Nazi thieves. The cast includes some well-known names like George Clooney, Matt Damon, and Bill Murray.

Alternatively, if you're up for a noir-ish drama set in post-war Berlin, "The Good German" might be just the thing for you! It stars George Clooney and Tobey Maguire and revolves around a murder mystery involving both of their characters. The intriguing plot and atmospheric setting make it an engaging watch. Enjoy your movie time!

Another war film that might appeal to you is "Platoon," which offers a shrewd examination of the brutality of war and the duality of man in conflict, with memorable roles from actors such as Tom Berenger and Johnny Depp.

Based on your preference for war genre films and the fact that you're looking for something with a different mood, I would recommend "The Imitation Game" (2014). This film is set during World War II and follows the story of Alan Turing, a mathematical genius who tries to crack the German Enigma code. The film also stars Benedict Cumberbatch, known for his captivating performances.

If you're interested in a more lighthearted comedy-drama, "Wonder Boys" (1995) might be a good fit too. It features an English professor dealing with personal and professional challenges, and boasts an impressive cast including Robert Downey Jr., Tobey Maguire, and Frances McDormand.
